current_portfolio.thesis: Alphabet is the anchor holding for any aggressive growth portfolio. At $338.53, it just broke out to 52-week highs. The company dominates search (90%+ share), is gaining cloud market share vs AWS, and is rapidly integrating AI across all products. Unlike peers, GOOG trades at a reasonable multiple for its growth profile. The Waymo robotaxi business is inflecting toward profitability and represents massive hidden optionality. With 33 years to compound, this is a generational hold.

The memory chip shortage headlines are not noise—this is a structural supply/demand imbalance driven by insatiable AI demand for HBM (High Bandwidth Memory). MU is up 41.78% in one month but still has significant runway. Revenue growth of 56.7% YoY is accelerating. The news about Apple facing iPhone pricing pressure due to memory shortages directly benefits MU's pricing power. Unlike NVDA (which is priced for perfection), MU trades at a more attractive valuation relative to its growth. This is THE memory play for the AI supercycle.

Copper is the 'new oil' for the electrification megatrend. Every EV uses 4x the copper of an ICE vehicle. Grid modernization, AI data centers, and renewable energy infrastructure all require massive copper inputs. Supply is constrained—permitting new mines takes 15+ years. SCCO is the world's largest publicly traded copper producer with best-in-class margins. At $190.32 with +30.82% momentum and 39% revenue growth, this is riding a multi-decade structural tailwind. For a 33-year investment horizon, copper exposure is essential.

Gold at $444.95 with +11.55% momentum is screaming inflation and uncertainty. Headlines suggest 'last stop before $10,000' gold—while hyperbolic, the direction is clear. Dollar weakness (UUP declining), geopolitical tensions (news mentions 'tensions loom'), and central bank buying create a structural bid. In a late-cycle inflationary regime, gold is THE hedge. For an aggressive portfolio, 10% gold allocation provides ballast without sacrificing growth. This is insurance that pays you while you wait.

PLTR at $146.59 with RSI at 14.3 is a gift. This is deeply oversold on a technical basis while fundamentals remain stellar—62.8% revenue growth, government contracts expanding, and commercial adoption accelerating via their AI platform. The 'avoid technology' late-cycle advice doesn't apply to mission-critical AI infrastructure. Palantir's government relationships (defense, intelligence) provide recession-resistant revenue while commercial AIP adoption is inflecting. This is high-beta but the risk/reward at oversold levels is asymmetric.

notable_politician_trades.insight: IREN is an AI/crypto data center and mining company. Purchase aligns with our AI energy infrastructure thesis. Small dollar amount but directionally interesting given AI power demand headlines.
Selling Northrop Grumman while defense stocks are rallying (LMT +29.96%). Profit-taking after strong run? Or insider view on defense budget? Watch for follow-through.
